pycwa 0.1.1
  • Reference

Read Axivity CWA file

Source: R/reader.R
py_convert_cwa.Rd

Read Axivity CWA file

py_convert_cwa(
  file,
  skipCalibration = TRUE,
  outputFolder = NULL,
  verbose = FALSE,
  timeZone = "Europe/London",
  timeShift = 0,
  startTime = NULL,
  endTime = NULL,
  epochPeriod = 30L,
  sampleRate = 100L,
  useFilter = TRUE,
  csvStartTime = NULL,
  csvSampleRate = NULL,
  calOffset = c(0, 0, 0),
  calSlope = c(1, 1, 1),
  calTemp = c(0, 0, 0),
  meanTemp = 20,
  stationaryStd = 13,
  rawDataParser = c("AccelerometerParser", "omconvert"),
  javaHeapSpace = NULL
)

py_read_cwa(file, ...)

Arguments

file

the <.cwa/.cwa.gz> file to process (e.g. sample.cwa.gz). If the file path contains spaces,it must be enclosed in quote marks
skipCalibration

skip calibration?
outputFolder

folder for all of the output files
verbose

enable verbose logging?
timeZone

timezone in country/city format to be used for daylight savings crossover check
timeShift

time shift to be applied, e.g. -15 will shift the device internal time by -15 minutes. Not to be confused with timezone offsets.
startTime

removes data before this time (local) in the final analysis
endTime

removes data after this time (local) in the final analysis
epochPeriod

length in seconds of a single epoch
sampleRate

resample data to n Hz
useFilter

Filter ENMO trunc values?
csvStartTime

start time for csv file when time column is not available (e.g. 2020-01-01T00:01)
csvSampleRate

sample rate for csv file when time column is not available in Hz, or samples/second
calOffset

accelerometer calibration offset
calSlope

accelerometer calibration slope linking offset to temperature
calTemp

mean temperature in degrees Celsius of stationary data for calibration
meanTemp

mean calibration temperature in degrees
stationaryStd

stationary mg threshold
rawDataParser

type of parser to use. If omconvert, this must be installed in your environment path
javaHeapSpace

amount of heap space (in MB) allocated to the java subprocesses, useful for limiting RAM usage
...

not used

Value

A list of files for the output

Examples

file =  system.file("extdata", "ax3_testfile.cwa.gz", package = "pycwa")
print(pycwa:::check_python_requirements())

#> [1] FALSE
if (pycwa:::have_python_requirements()) {
    res = pycwa::py_convert_cwa(file, verbose = 2)
}

#> Warning: pycwa may not work:  packages not found, please try to install using reticulate::py_install(NULL)
# \donttest{
  if (pycwa:::have_python_requirements()) {
    df = pycwa::py_read_cwa(file, startTime = "2019-02-26T10:55:15")
  }

#> Warning: pycwa may not work:  packages not found, please try to install using reticulate::py_install(NULL)
# }
